meanings.definition: An example or single occurrence of something.
meanings.sent1: In some instances, the teacher allows students to work in pairs.
meanings.sent2: She remembered a few instances where her dog had chased squirrels.
meanings.sent3: During one instance, the cat tried to catch a bird but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The instance of the rainbow after the storm was truly magical.
meanings.sent5: The instance of kindness from a stranger left a lasting impression on her.

meanings.definition: A particular case or occurrence of a situation.
meanings.sent1: There have been instances of heavy rainfall causing flooding in the area.
meanings.sent2: One instance of miscommunication led to a big misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The instance of the clumsy waiter dropping all the plates was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The instance of the car breaking down on the highway was a nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The instance of the power outage during the storm left everyone in the dark.

meanings.definition: To cite as an example or proof.
meanings.sent1: He instances his own experience to support his argument.
meanings.sent2: She instances the success stories of previous clients to showcase her skills.
meanings.sent3: The detective instances the fingerprints found at the crime scene as evidence.
meanings.sent4: The scientist instances the research studies to back up his hypothesis.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer instances similar cases to build a strong case for her client.
